urlText: T1 North Shore Line: Buses replace Central Coast & Newcastle Line between Hornsby and Berowra
content:
Monday 15 to Thursday 18 April   
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 2.30am, buses replace Central Coast & Newcastle Line trains between Hornsby and Berowra.
  • T1 North Shore Line trains continue to run between Hornsby and Berowra, to the normal timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
1CN Gosford, express to Berowra then Hornsby and return
2CN Woy Woy, then all stations to Point Clare, then express to Berowra, then all stations to Hornsby and return

urlText: Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern. Buses replace some trains
content:
Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 April  
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and the City via Granville, then continue to T1 North Shore Line stations. You will need to change trains if travelling to Circular Quay, St James or Museum.

  • From 10.40pm Saturday to 5.30am Sunday, buses replace all trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and Ashfield via Granville.
  • Change at Strathfield for express buses to Central, or change at Ashfield for buses stopping all-stations towards Central.

  • Sunday from 6.20am to 10.30am, buses replace Inner West trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • Leppington trains continue to run between Leppington and T1 North Shore Line stations and make an extra stop at Homebush.
  • Some T9 Northern Line trains also make extra stops at Croydon and Ashfield.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
Saturday night and Sunday morning only
40T2 Strathfield, then express to Central and return (until 5am Sunday only)
42T2 Ashfield, then all stations to Stanmore then express to Central and return
46T2 Ashfield, then all stations to Central and return

content:
Monday 15 to Thursday 18 April
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, Leppington trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and Central, platforms 1-12, via Granville, and will not stop at Ashfield or Newtown. Some T1 and T9 trains make an extra stop at Ashfield.
  • Inner West trains run to a changed timetable between Liverpool or Homebush and North Sydney due to trackwork on the City Circle.

  • Wednesday from 11pm to 1.30am, buses replace Inner West trains between Strathfield and Ashfield.
  • Trains run between Ashfield and North Sydney, to a changed timetable.
  • Most T1 Western Line trains make extra stops at Homebush and Burwood.

urlText: T1 Western Line: Buses replace trains between Penrith, Richmond and Granville
content:
Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 April
  • Buses replace trains between Penrith, Richmond and Granville.
  • Trains run to a changed timetable between Granville and the City, then continue to T1 North Shore Line stations.
  • Buses also run between some T1 Western Line stations and Tallawong.
    At Tallawong you can change for metro services to Epping, then change for a T9 Northern Line train to the City.

  • From 10.40pm Saturday to 5.30am Sunday, buses replace all trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • Trains run between Granville and Ashfield only, to a changed timetable.
  • Change at Strathfield for express buses to Central, or change at Ashfield for buses stopping all-stations towards Central.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

urlText: City Circle: Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay
content:
Monday 15 to Thursday 18 April
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay.
  • T2 Leppington and T8 Airport & South Line trains start and end at Central.
  • T1 North Shore & Western, T2 Inner West and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central and Wynyard.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall, Martin Place and Kings Cross.
  • The light rail runs in both directions between Circular Quay and Central.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or walk
    • Museum or St James, change at Central or Town Hall for local buses or walk

  • Other lines are also affected by this work. Please check details before you travel.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
subtitle: City Circle: Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay

urlText: Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Sydenham
content:
Monday 15 to Friday 19 April
  • Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Sydenham.
  • Most trains run between Liverpool and the City via Regents Park, and between Sydenham and the City Circle, some to a changed timetable.
  • Monday to Thursday, nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line trains run between Sydenham and Bondi Junction, making extra stops at St Peters and Erskineville.

  • Tuesday and Wednesday, nightly from 10.40pm to 1.30am, and Friday from 9.40pm, some trains run between Liverpool and Lidcombe via Regents Park only. Change trains at Lidcombe to continue your journey.

  • Trackwork continues on parts of the T3 Bankstown Line until 24 April.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes

1AT3 Dulwich Hill, Marrickville and then Sydenham, and return (Mon – Fri, 6.30am to 9.30am)
8T3 Lidcombe, then all stations to Bankstown and return
8AT3 Lidcombe, then express to Bankstown and return
10T3 Bankstown, then all stations to Sydenham and return
13T3 Campsie, Canterbury, then express to Sydenham and return
33T3 Bankstown, then all stations to Belmore, then express to Sydenham and return

urlText: Anzac Day Sydney CBD bus diversions
content:
From 5.30am until 4pm on Thursday 25 April, services will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place and March along Elizabeth St in the Sydney CBD.
 
Services to and from Circular Quay will divert around Elizabeth St via Wentworth Ave, College St and Macquarie St. Stops on Elizabeth St, Phillip St and Liverpool St between Museum and Circular Quay will be missed.
 
Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time. Visit the Anzac Day Dawn Service & March – Sydney CBD event page for more transport details.
subtitle: Anzac Day Sydney CBD bus diversions
